title: How to pronounce TREASURE /ˈtrɛʒɚ/ and PRESSURE /prɛʃɚ/ - American English Pronunciation Lesson

json.text: Welcome to the minute of speech. This confusing word pair is a request from
vietnam. The words are treasure valuables
kept in hiding and pressure the feeling of stressful urgency. To say
these words correctly, focus on both the first sounds T and P and the middle sounds ZH and
SH. To say treasure start by saying TR do this by touching the tip of the tongue
to the back of the top front teeth for the T then pull it down for the R
Your lips will be slightly rounded. Move to the short vowel e and the
ZH made with your tongue in the middle  of your mouth while your lips are rounded
and your voice is on your voice must be on or it will sound like Sh instead of
ZH. End with the er treasure. To say pressure start by saying PR do this by
pressing your lips together for the P then moving to the R by opening and
slightly rounding the lips move to the short vowel eh.  Add a sh which is  made with your
tongue in the middle of your mouth while your lips are rounded and your voice is
off SH end with the er pressure let's try it
treasure treasure treasure pressure pressure pressure treasure pressure.
He was under extreme pressure to locate the treasure he was under extreme pressure
to locate the treasure. Try it
